alert.note: Alert for Evans; Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, EVANS, LIBERTY, BULLOCH, LONG AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 958 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Denmark to Groveland to near Mendes, and moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Statesboro, Glennville, Claxton, Pembroke, Lanier, Brooklet, Hagan, and Daisy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Evans; Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall
